About.title: My journey
About.BeginningCarpentryDesc: I began my journey in construction at carpentry school, where I learned the fundamentals of working with wood, tools, and measurements. More importantly, I developed discipline, punctuality, and a strong attention to detail—skills that would later become crucial in my career.
About.ProfessionalExperienceDesc: After graduating, I spent five years on job sites, working closely with experienced carpenters. This hands-on experience strengthened my problem-solving skills and adaptability. Teamwork and clear communication were essential daily, ensuring projects ran smoothly. Through this, I learned patience and perseverance—qualities that now shape my approach to coding and problem-solving.
About.TransitionWebDevDesc: I transitioned into web development through an intensive 8-month ACS program. The fast-paced curriculum required dedication, and by the end, only a dozen students remained out of 30. This experience solidified my technical foundation and further developed my resilience. While I enjoyed carpentry, I found the industry's structure limiting, and the physical demands challenging. Government incentives for retraining in tech provided the final push I needed to pursue web development—a field where creativity, problem-solving, and continuous learning are key.
About.SkillDevelopmentDesc: Throughout 2023, I honed my skills in React through Udemy courses and explored Java, which helped me refine my focus on frontend development. Despite facing challenges in landing my first role, I gained valuable insights through interviews and remained committed to improving my craft.
About.ReadyForImpactDesc: Eager to apply my technical skills and problem-solving mindset to real-world projects, contributing to innovative and impactful development work.
